page.title: 13THE FATE OF SALVINGTON MILL
page.content: This ancient wooden postmill has stood on the 106m slopes of Bost Hill since 1700 AD. The mill was active until 1897, following which the buildings became dilapidated.Converted 1907 into tea rooms,and became a popular attraction for the numerous visitors to Worthing. Since 1954,the mill has been administered by the Friends of Salvington Mill Society,who,through Sunday openings and fundraising activities,have tried to restore the mill.Unfortunately,Salvington Mill occupies a large attractive site,well served by communications,in a zone ripe for development.Starved of land, the builders of Worthing are eager to develop the site of the mill.
